content.description: Fun little problem on the left side of the Brown Cow Boulder. Jugs to a fun topout.
content.location: Two problems left of Brown Cow. RIght in front of a small tree.

content.description: Left most (of the good climbs) on the first boulder. Goes up the center of the wall utilizing two big sloping square pinch features. Tops out up and left.
content.location: Center of the Wall, starts on obvious Jug feature. Down climb is back and left of the boulder.

content.description: Good but short. Sit Start on the farthest right side of the first boulder in the Brown Cow Area, on small edges. Climb up the seams and edges to juggy top out.
content.location: On the farthest right side of the boulder.

content.description: Short and Dirty Crack on the right side of the first boulder you come to at the Brown Cow Area
content.location: Obvious crack on the right side of the first boulder in the Brown Cow Area

content.description: Dig hard on that heel and follow the bad slopers up and right to the start of Sukha stand. Start hold tends to be wet for a while after a good rain.
content.location: Sit start low and left of the start for Sukha, and follow the bad slopers.

content.description:
Really fun!! Classic Holy Boulders Slopey Jugs to a hard topout. Starts directly to the left of the arete on the Brown Cow Face.  

super fun and easy dyno eliminates can be done on this climb if you're into that :) d
content.location: Rightmost line on the same face as Brown Cow. Big Slopers and Jugs. This also serves as the downclimb. .. stack pads and jump off.

content.description: Tall face to the right of Brown Cow. Start on high start holds and climb up the featured wall.
content.location: on the rightside of the Brown Cow face, seven feet left of the arete.

content.description: Start on low jug undercling and do a big move up and right, out of the overhang to a good edge. Match the edge and finish on jugs. Crux is not draggin yo azz on da ground.
content.location: directly down and right from Brown Cow. Starts on jug undercling in the chossy mini roof low to ground.

content.description: Sit Start on two 1 pad crimp/seam/edges and either go out left to a pinch on the arete and then head up, or do a big left hand move straight up to a good rail. Juggy topout.
content.location: The leftmost line on the back face of the Brown Cow Boulder. Right around the arete from Sukha.

content.description: The first route on the next boulder if heading right up the trail from Sukha. The sloper up and right of the first crimp on the face looks good, but is practically useless; bumping your left hand up the rail is the better option.
content.location: Start low on the big holds immediately right of the tree, move up the rail until beneath the slopey crimp. Then move up directly to the slopey rail and top out.  Going out right into the groove puts you on the V2 variation.

content.description: The starting section has a fun sequence moving through big holds. Easy topout.
content.location: Start the same as Fisherman direct, but move farther up the rail until in the groove, and then move up to the topout from there.

content.description: Start in slopers at chest height and traverse right through more slopers to a somewhat dirty topout. Fun, just needs more traffic. Walk right to get off the boulder.
content.location: To the Right of Cross and Toss.

content.description: Fun little warmup on good slopey edges. Farthest right line on the backside of the Brown Cow boulder. Short but sweet.
content.location: Just to the left of the arete on the backside of the Brown Cow Boulder. Farthest right line.

content.description: On the first boulder at the Brown Cow Boulder. Traverse left from the farthest right sit start holds to the V2 (I) and top out as such. A good warm up.
content.location: Runs the length of the first boulder

content.description: Fun climbing on cool edge features to a high right hand gaston finger bucket and a fun topout. Starts on the ledge features which is used as a heelhook on Brown Cow.
content.location: Start directly left of Brown Cow.

content.description: Start in good edges with a big ass right foot down low. Climb left and then up. Heed the name. Do a righthand cross move to a good slot, and then jump out left to a comfortable slopey jug. Big jugs all the way to the top! instant classic. Thanks to Phillip and the ICA for cleaning off all of these old classics!!!
content.location: The line directly right of Helios.

content.description: To the Right of "V2 (I)." Starts on a Jug and climbs up and right through crimpy flakes and sidepulls, and eventually a righthand seam. Tops out using a juggy "spearhead" looking hold.
content.protection: pads and spotters... Be careful of the flexing edges down low. Dont step on them too much!
content.location: To the left of the obvious jug crack on the first boulder in the Brown Cow Area.

content.description: Community Service stars on a left hand pinch and a slopey crimp for the right. Work your way up the boulder using slopers and pinches.
content.location: This problem is located on the right side of the same boulder as The Fisherman.

content.description: Fun but contrived. Climbs the obvious brown streak of wall with black speckles. Start on your choice of low start holds (a left hand edge, and a right hand crimp or right hand slopy pinch) with a massive left heel hook. The heel hook ledge is "off" for a hand. Figure out some beta and work your way up powerful sidepull pockets and features to some sharp jugs and a thoughtful topout. Holies V6.
content.location: The obvious brown speckled streak of wall with lots of chalk.

content.description: Sit Start on obvious crimper plate/flake feature. Do a big lockoff up and right to some good slopers, fun and casual topout. Wish it were longer!!
content.location: Second rightmost climb on the backside of the Brown Cow Boulder. Starts low on obvious crimp plate feature.

content.description: A short, ugly boulder problem (similar to the first ascentionist), which consists of two moves. Starting on a jug with a right heel hook reach to a bad sloping edge and then do either a big bump to a jug up and right or match, then do the big bump.
content.location: The farthest left line on the first boulder in the Brown Cow Area. Starts right of a tree, on a good jug very low to the ground.

content.description: This area includes three separate boulders and a number of problems ranging from V0 to V6 including many unique and really fun V4s.
